intro: Triteleia dudleyi, commonly known as Dudley's triteleia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 12 to 24 inches and produces clusters of small, fragrant blossoms in early spring. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are evergreen throughout the year. Triteleia dudleyi thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, wet winters and warm, dry summers of its native habitat.
